intro: Dicoma hindiana, commonly known as the Indian dicoma, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing adaptations to dry environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. The flowers are yellow to orange in color, often blooming in clusters, making it a distinctive and ornamental species.
